title: Fix for target_link_libraries on CMake 2.8
body_html:
#559 downgrades to CMake 2.8 which causes this error:

/usr/bin/ld: cannot find -lPRIVATE
https://travis-ci.org/lukeyeager/pytorch/jobs/194939994

If I'm reading the documentation correctly, CMake 3.0 supports either PRIVATE or LINK_PRIVATE. CMake 2.8 only supports LINK_PRIVATE.

The build succeeds now on Ubuntu 12.04, where CMake is 2.8.
https://travis-ci.org/lukeyeager/pytorch/jobs/194985407
body_text:
#559 downgrades to CMake 2.8 which causes this error:

/usr/bin/ld: cannot find -lPRIVATE
https://travis-ci.org/lukeyeager/pytorch/jobs/194939994

If I'm reading the documentation correctly, CMake 3.0 supports either PRIVATE or LINK_PRIVATE. CMake 2.8 only supports LINK_PRIVATE.
The build succeeds now on Ubuntu 12.04, where CMake is 2.8.
https://travis-ci.org/lukeyeager/pytorch/jobs/194985407
body:
https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/559 downgrades to CMake 2.8 which causes this error:

> /usr/bin/ld: cannot find -lPRIVATE
https://travis-ci.org/lukeyeager/pytorch/jobs/194939994

If I'm reading the documentation correctly, CMake 3.0 [supports](https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.0/command/target_link_libraries.html) either `PRIVATE` or `LINK_PRIVATE`. CMake 2.8 only [supports](https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v2.8.8/cmake.html#command:target_link_libraries) `LINK_PRIVATE`.

The build succeeds now on Ubuntu 12.04, where CMake is [2.8](http://packages.ubuntu.com/precise/cmake).
https://travis-ci.org/lukeyeager/pytorch/jobs/194985407
